  • Field Details

    • key

      protected me.wolfyscript.utilities.util.NamespacedKey key

    • slots

      protected int[] slots
      These are the slots selected by the merge option. For crafting recipes they indicate the Ingredient id/s. For any other recipe with fixed slots they indicate the inventory slot.

    • getNamespacedKey

      public me.wolfyscript.utilities.util.NamespacedKey getNamespacedKey()
      Specified by:
      getNamespacedKey in interface me.wolfyscript.utilities.util.Keyed

    • mergeCrafting

      public abstract org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack mergeCrafting​(CraftingData craftingData, org.bukkit.entity.Player player, me.wolfyscript.utilities.api.inventory.custom_items.CustomItem customResult, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack result)
      Called when the data is merged inside of crafting recipes.
      Crafting Recipes have no reliable positions of ingredients as they can be flipped or have no order at all! Therefore this separate method is used with additional data of Ingredient positions and content.
      Parameters:
      player - The player that crafted the item.
      craftingData - The CraftingData containing all the info of the grid state.
      customResult - The CustomItem of the crafted item.
      result - The actual manipulable result ItemStack. (Previous adapters might have already manipulated this item!)
      Returns:
      The manipulated ItemStack that should be passed to the next adapter or set as the end result.

    • merge

      public abstract org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack merge​(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack[] ingredients, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player player, me.wolfyscript.utilities.api.inventory.custom_items.CustomItem customResult, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack result)
      Called when the data is merged inside of recipes with fixed slots like Furnace, Smithing Table, etc.

      Not called for crafting recipes! Use mergeCrafting(CraftingData, Player, CustomItem, ItemStack) for merging of Crafting Recipe items!

      Parameters:
      player - The player that has crafted the item. Might be null in case of the Furnace!
      customResult - The CustomItem of the crafted item.
      result - The actual manipulable result ItemStack. (Previous adapters might have already manipulated this item!)
      Returns:
      The manipulated ItemStack that should be passed to the next adapter or set as the end result.
